intro: Gouania crenata var. cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. This plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
